title: Work by Jean Dubuffet
description: This exhibition was a major retrospective that was put together with assistance to the curator from Jean Dubuffet himself, as well as his colleague Pierre Matisse. Nearly 200 works were selected for the exhibit, giving spectators a comprehensive look into Dubuffet’s career, which blended technique and imagery from the Fauves and Die Brücke movements. Among some of the more famous series of Dubuffet paintings in this show included his Le Corps de Dames, Sols et Terrains, and various imprints made from assemblages. The exhibition placed a special emphasis on Dubuffet’s love of new materials and technique which propelled him to explore his medium and push limits.
